alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:54PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Essex and northeastern Middlesex Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 354 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Middleton, or near North Andover, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Haverhill, Peabody, Andover, North Andover, Danvers, Wakefield, Reading, Wilmington, North Reading, Ipswich, Lynnfield, Middleton, Georgetown, Boxford, Hamilton, Newbury, Groveland, Topsfield, Rowley and Wenham. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
